newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - January 14.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - January 14.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Dalai Lama expected to visit Taiwan in March.
Six companies win Taiwan mobile franchises.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - German firm Huels plans huge investment project in Taiwan.
Vice-President Lien Chan makes low-key stopover in Paris.
LIBERTY TIMES - Taiwan awards eight mobile franchise licences, mobile phone fees expected to enter low-cost era.
Several farmers' credit unions in southern Chiayi face bank run over police's investigation of Chiayi county speaker Hsiao Teng-piao.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Eight mobile franchise licences given to six companies as part of Taiwan's effort to liberalise telecommunications industry.
Government plans new rules to prevent bank run in financial institutions.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Foreign investment trusts allowed to invest in local stock market.
Depositors at Chiayi farmers credit unions withdraw total of T$510 million.
